means: <爱尔兰>哭丧女（尤指职业的哭丧女人）

sentence.Network_en: Smell is keener in dogs than in humans.
sentence.Network_cn: 狗的嗅觉比人的嗅觉灵敏.

sentence.Network_en: Presently, with the arrival of a keener sense of cold, one figure came forward.
sentence.Network_cn: 不久, 因为更加感到寒冷难忍, 有一个人走上前来.

sentence.Network_cn: 这个可怕的年轻女人对男人的吸引力远不仅仅是无与伦比的美丽.

catherine keener凯瑟琳基纳凯瑟琳·基纳1960年3月26日生于美国迈阿密，曾在影片《视线之外》(OUT

entry.def: If you are keen on doing something, you very much want to do it. If you are keen that something should happen, you very much want it to happen.

example.ex: You're not keen on going, are you?...
example.tran: 你不太想去，是吗？

example.ex: Both companies were keen on a merger...
example.tran: 两家公司都很想合并。

entry.def: If you are keen on something, you like it a lot and are very enthusiastic about it.

example.ex: I got quite keen on the idea...
example.tran: 我对这个想法燃起了极大的热情。

example.ex: I wasn't too keen on physics and chemistry.
example.tran: 我对物理和化学不是太感喜爱。

entry.def: You use keen to indicate that someone has a lot of enthusiasm for a particular activity and spends a lot of time doing it.

example.ex: She was a keen amateur photographer.
example.tran: 她是业余摄影爱好者。

entry.def: If you describe someone as keen, you mean that they have an enthusiastic nature and are interested in everything that they do.

example.ex: He's a very keen student and works very hard...
example.tran: 他是个很好学的学生，学习非常努力。

example.ex: You're all very keen.
example.tran: 你们都很热心。

entry.def: A keen interest or emotion is one that is very intense.

example.ex: He had retained a keen interest in the progress of the work.
example.tran: 他对那项工作的进展一直很关心。

example.ex: ...his keen sense of loyalty.
example.tran: 他强烈的忠诚感

entry.def: If you are a keen supporter of a cause, movement, or idea, you support it enthusiastically.

example.ex: He's been a keen supporter of the Labour Party all his life...
example.tran: 他一生都是工党的热情拥护者。

example.ex: He is a keen advocate of park-and-ride schemes.
example.tran: 他是“停车再换乘”计划的热情拥护者。

entry.tran: 思维敏捷的；机灵的；机智的
entry.def: If you say that someone has a keen mind, you mean that they are very clever and aware of what is happening around them.

example.ex: They described him as a man of keen intellect...
example.tran: 他们把他描述成一个才思敏捷的人。

example.ex: Mr Walsh has a keen appreciation of the priorities of the electorate...
example.tran: 沃尔什先生深刻理解选民最为关注的事项。

entry.def: If you have a keen eye or ear, you are able to notice things that are difficult to detect.

example.ex: ...an amateur artist with a keen eye for detail...
example.tran: 对细节非常敏感的业余画家

example.ex: Brand's keen ear caught the trace of an accent.
example.tran: 布兰德敏锐的耳朵听出了口音。

entry.def: If you are keen on someone, you find them sexually attractive and want to get to know them better.

example.ex: Mick has always been very keen on Carla.
example.tran: 米克一直迷恋卡拉。

entry.def: A keen fight or competition is one in which the competitors are all trying very hard to win, and it is not easy to predict who will win.

example.ex: There is expected to be a keen fight in the local elections.
example.tran: 预计地方选举的竞争会非常激烈。

entry.def: Keen prices are low and competitive.

example.ex: The company negotiates very keen prices with their suppliers.
example.tran: 该公司通过讨价还价从供货商那里拿到了很低的价格。

entry.def: If someone keens, they cry out or make sounds to express their sorrow at someone's death.

example.ex: He tossed back his head and keened...
example.tran: 他仰天恸哭起来。

example.ex: Someone was making a low, keening noise.
example.tran: 有人正在低声哀泣。

entry.tran: 对…十分热衷；对…非常热情
entry.def: If you say that someone is mad keen on something, you are emphasizing that they are very enthusiastic about it.

example.ex: So you're not mad keen on science then?...
example.tran: 那么你对科学并不是太感兴趣了？

example.ex: She was mad keen to go.
example.tran: 她非常想去。

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Investors are keener than usual on REITs because of their relatively juicy yields.
